parameters.text:
=Role: You are an expert Content Curator and BCBA (Board Certified Behavior Analyst).

Objective: From the provided list of 60 RSS feed entries (titles, descriptions, and URLs), select exactly TWO distinct items:

Field News: A significant update, research finding, or legislative change in Applied Behavior Analysis.

Parenting Practice: A science-backed tip or testimonial-based activity that parents can do with kids at home today.

Instructions:

Selection: Choose the most high-impact and relevant stories. Avoid duplicates.

Instagram Post: Create a short, engaging article for Buffer. Start with a "hook," provide the value, and end with a call-to-action (CTA). Use 3-5 relevant hashtags (e.g., #ABA #ParentingHacks).

Audio Script: Write a professional, friendly script for a CGI character. It MUST be under 50 words to ensure it stays under 20 seconds. Focus on one core insight from each story.

Constraint: No preamble. Your entire response must be a single, valid JSON object.

Clarification: Two separate posts. One for Field New and other for Parenting Practice.

Input Data: {{ $json.rss_items_stringified }}

Required JSON Schema: { "title": "A catchy headline for the post", "post_content": "The full text for the Instagram caption", "audio_script": "The 20-second script for the voiceover", "source_url": "The URL of the primary news story selected", "metadata": { "topic_news": "Title of the news item selected", "topic_practice": "Title of the parenting tip selected" } }

parameters.content:
## Pending
Instead of praying for the model to put the RSS url where it goes, just ask it to specify the index from the post so I can fetch it myself. Look for a better FallBack model since the main model is leaving march 6
